term.title: π-adduct

item.text: An adduct formed by electron-pair donation from a π-orbital into a σ-orbital, or from a σ-orbital into a π-orbital, or from a π-orbital into a π-orbital. For example: [image: Not defined] Such an adduct has commonly been known as a 'π-complex', but, as the bonding is not necessarily weak, it is better to avoid the term complex.

sources.item: PAC, 1994, 66, 1077. 'Glossary of terms used in physical organic chemistry (IUPAC Recommendations 1994)' on page 1154 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199466051077)
PAC, 1995, 67, 1307. 'Glossary of class names of organic compounds and reactivity intermediates based on structure (IUPAC Recommendations 1995)' on page 1312 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199567081307)

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
